intro: Escobaria sneedii var. orcuttii, commonly known as the Orcutt's liveforever, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species suited for xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a desirable plant for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
